abstract: Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, Libya's erratic and provocative dictator for 42 years, who crushed opponents at home while cultivating the wardrobe and looks befitting an aging rock star, dies at age 69; throughout his rule, Qaddafi sanctioned spasms of violence and bedlam, as he sought to leverage Libya's oil wealth into an outsize role on the world stage.
snippet: Throughout his rule, Colonel Qaddafi, 69, sanctioned spasms of violence and bedlam, as he sought to leverage Libya’s oil wealth into an outsize role on the world stage.

headline.main: An Erratic Leader, Brutal and Defiant to the End
headline.print_headline: An Erratic Leader, Brutal and Defiant to the End
headline.seo: Muammar el-Qaddafi, Libyan Dictator, Is Dead at 69
